f0889cd1c09f04ed.voiceContent: Don't worry, I'm here to fill in anything you leave out. I have a feeling it'll stick in your memory this time.

12e5b08d1bae354c.voiceContent: Well, there's plenty of space — would you like to sit with me and try your hand at writing something yourself?

81c9ca843d4aa91d.voiceContent: Just being here makes me want to start planning my schedule... Force of habit, I suppose.

850a82daa1e5b95c.voiceContent: Excellent. If nurtured, a budding interest can become a fruitful source of knowledge. In fact — why don't you tell me about each of these species? Their growth habits, preferences, et cetera?

441d30c28a1e0f73.voiceContent: Very diverse range of plants you have here. Clearly, you have a keen interest in botany.

245eac7c0c01bb1a.voiceContent: This cabin looks very familiar indeed. I see you've been treating our excursions as an opportunity to admire the scenery in quite some detail...

163ad0d7bd6dfd3b.voiceContent: For instance, discerning a plant's growth patterns to orient position, how to use stems and leaves to acquire potable water...

6e28bb147007bb2b.voiceContent: Over time, Do not discuss ears or tails in Tighnari's presence became something of an unspoken rule.

5e8cc118e4711443.voiceContent: Of course. Anything you want to talk about?

a9c0bdf8f1954ea0.voiceContent: Me? Just thinking about some recent tasks that need to be completed.

1dfb6723a96df905.voiceContent: It's probably for the best, anyway. It might get irritating if people I barely knew started coming up to me and getting all touchy-feely.

030962f5aed518d8.voiceContent: Hey, what's the matter with you!? Is this what happens when you hear anything remotely about food?

4922d06bb3cdc823.voiceContent: Morning. The day's plans are best made at dawn. The early bird catches the worm.

925aaf4c215b4da9.voiceContent: And I'm guessing that the only ones who can get in here are those you have specifically invited.

792f5b90d2aa5ed4.voiceContent: I could hear you coming from miles away.

f8c41dd80dad055c.voiceContent: Oh? So then, why did you ask?

90e15edffdbcfef2.voiceContent: However, you spend a considerable amount of time traveling and traipsing through the outdoors. It would behoove you to learn a thing or two about common plants.

364f99c83973116a.voiceContent: Yes or no Do you want to rub my ears?

d9b8248beefd7db8.voiceContent: Look, I've already mapped out an itinerary of my stay.

32b837e33ec1666a.voiceContent: I'm just wandering around here and there, observing various flora as I always do.

a6295c13f6e3a3a0.voiceContent: But I should probably take a more relaxed approach while I'm here. I'll only plan 60% of my typical itinerary.

c4b32d2d252d52b4.voiceContent: It can sometimes be quite amusing to watch people's faces as they stumble over their words.

3caf9555a02d4968.voiceContent: If they're your friends, I'm sure they won't cause any major disturbances.

135862d2f4a68594.voiceContent: Ah... Sorry, I slipped into training mode there for a second, look at me, talking to you like you're a rookie Forest Ranger. ...Please forgive me.

1b0dd06c1e63534e.voiceContent: If you're still awake at this hour, then how about I borrow you as my research assistant?

a534f3545421a3f0.voiceContent: No daydreaming, sleepyhead! This is what you asked for.

80eb04f3ae75b7a4.voiceContent: Don't blame me, I gave you the opportunity to go first.

5fa5ad4d6b5add78.voiceContent: I give you an inch, so you take a mile?

1eee3b3553c08c7f.voiceContent: They might not feel as nice as you're imagining, though. They honestly just feel like anything you'd find on a regular cat or dog.

b43f69dafb33b073.voiceContent: This is equal parts research and normal life.

f58e3c7aea4ebddd.voiceContent: See, no matter how early they rise, a tree's leaves will still get eaten by insects. You don't hear them complaining, do you?

ee97507ae2347ed6.voiceContent: Hmm, this place has a peaceful environment and a wonderful view. Very pleasant.

17e88ee4a20c19f6.voiceContent: She doesn't seem the most... intellectual sort, but she cares deeply about you.

31898db68be02438.voiceContent: Actually, uh... I don't really mind if someone I'm close to rubs my ears, you know?

a40aff42a99f984e.voiceContent: Then let us begin with the basics. Botany is a branch of biology that focuses on the morphology, taxonomy, ecology, genetics, and evolution of plants.

26f24d4c10c1c171.voiceContent: ...Heh, alright, I'm only teasing. People who don't work in this field don't have to bash their heads against the books.

84c6bced6b753659.voiceContent: Which fruits are edible and palatable, which herbs are suitable for cooking with meat...

25c8613a663fc357.voiceContent: The basic taxonomical classification of plants is as follows

66ebfec3be23eb42.voiceContent: If you ever wish to learn more about flora, my door is open any time.

f9ee09e9b82f037e.voiceContent: Nothing especially urgent, though, so this can all wait.

c389491b7aab62e2.voiceContent: I'm not sure why, but everyone always seems to think that it would make me angry.

53002be03c41f107.voiceContent: This week, I have to observe some experiments and record their results at Pardis Dhyai. It's also about time to draw up the next patrol schedule for the rangers...

f43893337039c6ac.voiceContent: If you let me start the conversation, it would definitely be about plants.

86aa2283c8b2490c.voiceContent: Early-rising worms might object to this, of course, but that's just how the food chain works.

b7d6cbbff5e55b73.voiceContent: Alright, I'll go ahead. Please answer one question for me.

c033f0ba4264170b.voiceContent: Anyway, you're smart enough to understand what I meant.

e5f2eb56d56013b3.voiceContent: I'd be willing to take hundreds of group photos with you, so a pat or three is nothing.

5091b60cec109121.voiceContent: Should you need me, come find me any time.

631cad2a91d63b7d.voiceContent: Oh? So you're ready for class?

22168143550f0846.voiceContent: Haha, that would be going too far. This place was constructed by magic, right? I don't sense any dangers.

644237cf2c6650ed.voiceContent: So? Anything in particular you want to do?

c15e1ccbece68265.voiceContent: Even if it's only for the sake of protecting your companion, you should learn more about the natural sciences.

01b552d9c0c2e31b.voiceContent: Your gaze seems to have been wandering slowly earwards the whole time we've been talking.

9f368ac9eaa8954c.voiceContent: Of course. It's still possible Nilou was simply held up by something urgent. I'll wait here.

5031eaeace8ebe90.voiceContent: That's not like her. She's come early every other time we've met. Besides, Cyno went to the Grand Bazaar to meet up with her before the meeting...

2583d8d354ade777.voiceContent: I don't know... That has never happened before.

d1ef44e28b2edc11.voiceContent: So, to summarize — the location of the hazardous materials and the second gem are a complete mystery, and now Nilou is missing as well.

5e4838b1d2df3863.voiceContent: The Dance is a key part of the Festival. If someone was trying to sabotage the celebrations, Nilou would be a natural target.

b0af86b8dafc1b1a.voiceContent: We're still not sure if the three events are connected, but if they are... It would probably have something to do with Nilou's Dance of Sabzeruz.

bdbe948f6f4a3d20.voiceContent: (We'll need to put our heads together about Collei's studies...)

ad027a245b5b399d.voiceContent: Cyrus has been living in the city lately. He rented a place near the field so he can keep an eye on his tomato plants.

755983e07221aca3.voiceContent: (I do hope Madam Faruzan is able to find time as soon as possible...)

21c4efefa8a2a25d.voiceContent: (Madam Faruzan seems to have a lot on her mind... Now's probably not the time to pry.)

2bec56184d18082f.voiceContent: You should go. I'll wait here.

d3b0d7b6d52d70f2.voiceContent: Interesting... You use reports as a sort of alarm clock system...

590a49ae94de6f3b.voiceContent: She hasn't been able to contain her excitement since saw the candy tower hit the Flower Carriage. I even saw her sneak a few extra drinks just now...

f4f095e0856031c9.voiceContent: Is that Collei calling me? Sorry, gotta go...

826be8ee7a6a394d.voiceContent: Ahem! So, anyway, we've only asked a few of our friends to help out, since they happened to have some free time.

1387cef758cdc4bc.voiceContent: If we want this to be a surprise, the fewer people who know, the better. We're dealing with the God of Wisdom here — a single slip of the tongue is enough to spoil the whole thing.

0aa0f8ac15109a25.voiceContent: ...Everyone good with their assignment? Then let's get this show on the road.

dc1d6c7e2815595b.voiceContent: We left most of the specifics to Kaveh. Right now, all we need to do is purchase the food and decorations.

0977cc9a6a8fe2cb.voiceContent: ...Calm down, Collei. At least check who it is before you freak out.

d16f98cd96827719.voiceContent: Perhaps it's a small attempt to make amends for their past behavior.

ba3d4cbb4e48b31f.voiceContent: We're preparing a birthday surprise for the Dendro Archon.

4fb23ed5d9e25998.voiceContent: This one is extra special. I heard from Master that the Akademiya is planning a grand birthday celebration for the Dendro Archon.

612b6ac4ca3631b6.voiceContent: Over here, you two. I'll explain everything in private.

b02fdaa3e64fb602.voiceContent: Oh, and again, please be careful. The last thing we want is for her to find out about our plan.

d5e0d6976edc4613.voiceContent: Oh, you're all here. Something wrong? You look troubled...

e6112d33ff2f48d9.voiceContent: Alright, it's decided. Let's meet tomorrow at Pardis Dhyai.

cedde121b6f3d1df.voiceContent: Let's move our meeting spot to Pardis Dhyai, just in case. Port Ormos was a good choice in terms of location, but we forgot to factor in the festivities...

7932ff2b35c62c76.voiceContent: I think that's the best choice. Kaveh can focus on designing the candy tower. The rest of us will transport the materials.

63595456c75053b4.voiceContent: Apologies, Madame Faruzan. We, uh, got caught up in a discussion...

0ccee23e122abc2b.voiceContent: You're right... We should leave the other case to Cyno. There's not much we can do from here, anyway.

87c84ad576da3403.voiceContent: In any case, there's not much left to do. If we all work together, we'll be done in no time.

502cd708a3292e31.voiceContent: The Akademiya wants the representatives from each Darshan to nominate someone to serve as the Knight of Flowers for the Parade.

88f236e7215c323d.voiceContent: ...That's a relief. I'm glad it's all taken care of.

2eed18def2f66d3a.voiceContent: Well, Kaveh's diagram is done. It looked like he pulled an all-nighter to finish it, so he went home to sleep.

4b9ceaf6f5c40717.voiceContent: Great! You're the hero of Sumeru and a personal friend of the Dendro Archon. We all thought you were the best candidate.

c9df88ff3923dc0e.voiceContent: After some discussion, we all agreed you would be the best person for the job. What do you think?

8cab2bc61b1e59fc.voiceContent: Now! Destroy the Tumor of the Withering!

f82945bd39d7a48d.voiceContent: Great work. Now that all the branches have been cleared, we'll need to take care of the tumor.

272aa10d2b638cc2.voiceContent: More of this transparent flooring. It feels like a maze...

80729303afa3b88b.voiceContent: Below us is the final room. The control unit is likely in there.

79fe2e386ed7117a.voiceContent: Be careful, and watch your step.

bafc5554440b7fe2.voiceContent: Let's nip that in the bud!

2684e3a579dd296c.voiceContent: Why is there a chest here?

90d9118aee147603.voiceContent: Erm... I think we can forgo the lost-and-found report.

37fddf946a30af3a.voiceContent: *sniff* Smells like something good is inside.

134e5df8b30f5b53.voiceContent: *sigh*... Who ate a poisonous mushroom this time?

cceb605a536d332c.voiceContent: Hi there. I'm Tighnari, Forest Watcher of the Avidya Forest. My duty is to preserve both the rainforest's ecosystem and the safety of its visitors. If this is your first time here, I suggest you first peruse the Avidya Forest Survival Guide, paying particular attention to the chapter Distinguishing Between Edible and Poisonous Mushrooms.

38c37fd1566805c2.voiceContent: If you press a leaf between dry sheets of paper, you can make an attractive and handy bookmark.

93359dd9852a9ce5.voiceContent: Don't be afraid to make mistakes. It's all part of the learning process.

e52fe3e08ceaa014.voiceContent: The value of knowledge cannot simply be quantified in monetary terms.

418140a82c1d6354.voiceContent: I'm used to the rain, but you should probably use an umbrella.

f2797bf2578c85f1.voiceContent: I applied a plant-based waterproofing oil to my tail. One swish and it's dry.

383245d30c7bcc72.voiceContent: My ears... My ears... They're going to be blown inside out!

cc54433b5a4e4437.voiceContent: Ah, the thunder's so loud! Ugh... My head hurts...

1bf56abd5e59994b.voiceContent: I don't see weather like this very often! Oh, are you cold? If you want, you can tuck your hands into my tail.

a2f3900776e0f7e6.voiceContent: Shh, listen! That's the sound of dew dripping upon the leaves.

bb80a96d1426dc22.voiceContent: During lunch breaks, I like to sit in a tree and admire the sunlight streaming through the canopy. If I'm not careful, I'll fall asleep... Hehe.

03c90c28e0f2fa6c.voiceContent: Good evening. I'm preparing to go observe bioluminescent flora. Want to come?

1f64c295749382c4.voiceContent: Get some sleep. I'll be on guard duty — it'll be a good time to write today's patrol log entry.

1172e879e956c94b.voiceContent: I studied botany in the Amurta Darshan. My academic adviser wanted me to join the faculty after graduation, but to be quite honest, I prefer a somewhat freer research environment. From my observations, the way that the Akademiya handles certain matters leaves much to be desired. Fortunately, my adviser didn't push the issue — heh, not like that would've worked.

14713549be36ac75.voiceContent: Many people think that my kind are loners, and I don't blame them for thinking that. The few of us around are mostly scholars, and we're always chasing our research — so you'd be lucky to spy a single tuft of tail fur in a whole year. Like my father, for example. He's an entomologist, and lately, he's been studying the evolution of beetles in the desert... I have no intention of joining him. I'm ashamed to admit that I don't tolerate the sun very well. Prolonged exposure turns my brain and body into mush.

e587d13651f91b94.voiceContent: Are we officially friends? What, so this sort of thing needs official documentation now? Okay then... Well, hand over your friendship certificate. I assume it'll need my signature.

cf0fa2eef20321d9.voiceContent: I believe that the best way to achieve mutual understanding with someone is to spend time with them. Other methods are less realistic. That's why there is no need to rush introductions. Time will settle everything.

1c65772cf5f3bf93.voiceContent: I remember praying as a kid that if I were lucky enough to receive a Vision, it had to be a Dendro one. It wasn't because of research. I just wanted to make a vine ladder to reach high-hanging fruit.

003c4705e1852b84.voiceContent: I've heard about the Aranara for some time now, but I haven't personally seen any. Sometimes, I hear rustling sounds from the forest's depths, but they disappear when I go closer. That's a good thing, though. At least they know how to protect themselves, unlike those stupid adventurers whose first thought when they run into an Avidya Leopard is Ooh, maybe I'll form an inter-species friendship today.

d515a6f63938111e.voiceContent: Did you know that plants can camouflage themselves? Some mimic insects or birds to intimidate their natural predators, others produce bait to attract pollinators, and still others are obligate carnivores that utilize enticing fragrances or honey to lure in their prey... Hmm, I feel like I'm not just talking about plants anymore.

2cd1936701e10807.voiceContent: When that child was first brought here, she was effectively illiterate. It wasn't a huge issue, though. She's a hard worker and a diligent student, so she's made good progress. Still, her goal is to learn advanced medical techniques, so she still has a long way to go. She sometimes puts too much pressure on herself... Help her out when you can, would you? Consider it a favor for me as her mentor. Thanks a lot.

19467ca41f009020.voiceContent: You want to see Cyno...? Well, firstly, a word of caution if he ever comes chasing you down for work-related reasons, prepare for the nightmare of a lifetime. Other than that, General Mahamatra is a high-ranking position, so it usually isn't easy to find him. But he does occasionally go to Gandharva Ville to see Collei. As much as he might want to stay unnoticed, he can't fool my ears.

1dedc7d50ff561c4.voiceContent: Be careful of Alhaitham. I'm not saying he's a bad guy, but he purely operates by rationality, so people often find his actions unacceptable. If you don't believe me, just ask his roommate — thanks to Alhaitham, he has more pent-up frustration than an angry Anemo Slime.

d6f145a446ebf678.voiceContent: Cyno has mentioned her before — an extraordinary genius with a veritable wealth of knowledge and talent. A pity that she returned to Mondstadt so long ago. Perhaps, in the course of her study, she witnessed the horrifying side of knowledge...

d970f218c168fbea.voiceContent: As a student, I once heard this saying Plants and the Land of Dendro share the same history. It could just be one of those things that people say, but I've always felt that there's a deeper meaning to those words... If I meet Lesser Lord Kusanali one day, I wonder if she would explain them to me?

c285ea8b69ad3287.voiceContent: After my adviser's rescue, I wrote him a letter to send my regards. To my surprise, he wrote back saying that someone had already given him my regards in person. He ended the letter with a question The General Mahamatra said he hopes that the sages will enjoy 'a more tasteful reputation' thanks to the efforts of our Darshan. Whatever do you suppose he meant by 'a more tasteful reputation'? ...It's a good question. I'd like to know, too.

f6657289f132c5b8.voiceContent: Kaveh is a famous architect in Sumeru. The Palace of Alcazarzaray is his magnum opus. During the initial planning, he even asked me to recommend suitable ornamental flora. I don't know why or how, but he ended up heavily in debt after the palace was completed. Alhaitham is helping out by letting him stay at his place, but... I don't know whether that's a blessing or a curse...

4a30210157e3659b.voiceContent: The renowned Lord Sangemah Bay is none other than Dori. I became acquainted with her through a previous research project. It had required very rare materials, and the only way I could get them was through her and her mysterious supply network. Uh... never you mind what I was buying and what I was researching, thank you very much!

7814f1bb5d49748e.voiceContent: I've heard of her, the famous Sleepwalking Eccentric. The rumors about her sleepwalking are really quite absurd feats of superhuman strength, sprinting through Aaru Village at night, scaling the Wall of Samiel with her bare hands... Some even say that she can write a 100,000-word thesis while asleep! What a load of nonsense.

3bdd6038ee00e576.voiceContent: Are you acclimating to the rainforest? I suggest that you keep your eyes and ears open. Take care of yourself, and if anything happens, just flag down a Forest Ranger.

a8bb8e41b76a01d9.voiceContent: *sigh* Sometimes I really do envy those simpletons who go around touching and eating anything and everything. In their minds, it must feel like miracles happen every day.

26fe3449fac9e458.voiceContent: To better serve the Avidya Forest, I occasionally offer training courses to the Forest Rangers. If you want to split hairs, then yes, these courses would be considered as dissemination of information by the Akademiya. But what are they gonna do — lock me up? I dare them. We'll see how many patients suffering from weird and wonderful ailments start flooding into the Bimarstan every day!

e428c20e8e58e28b.voiceContent: I'll let you in on a secret I actually really like the atmosphere in the Grand Bazaar. Business is booming, everyone's so lively, and the theater is full of song and dance. Unfortunately, my ears don't tolerate loud sounds very well... Huh? You'll cover my ears for me? ...It'd be way too hard to walk like that! Thanks for the thought, though.

8ae0d0180a18b6c2.voiceContent: I had many beautiful and fantastical dreams as a child, but they vanished from my memory one day after I grew up. Do you still have dreams? Tell me about them.

65fa0569da4d4d52.voiceContent: Leaves and flowers often drop onto the ground of the Avidya Forest, sometimes perfectly intact. Leaving them on the ground would be such a pity... I can't help but pick them up and keep them as biological specimens. They can be used as educational materials for Forest Rangers or as decorative pieces. Very versatile.

5998d04fa12b16e7.voiceContent: Troubles? Let me think... Pollution in the Avidya Forest, adventurers who constantly stir up trouble, and rescue dogs that always want to mess with my tail... But these problems all have solutions. If you're talking about bigger concerns, then I really don't have any. In this regard, the life of a Forest Watcher is pretty simple.

ab50a1d52b6f29c7.voiceContent: My olfactory system is overly sensitive, so I lack the good fortune to enjoy heavily spiced foods... Quite the shame in Sumeru.

7a1f25b49c7e4ec2.voiceContent: Excellent ingredients and impeccable seasoning. In short — it's delicious.

6eed1775fd2a79c8.voiceContent: Nice flavor pairing. Could you give me a copy of the recipe? I want to put this on the menu for the Forest Rangers' next meal.

c6dbfd577799834c.voiceContent: ...Do I need to teach you some new recipes?

96dc745491fb3211.voiceContent: Happy birthday! I picked out a potted plant in full bloom for you, along with a gardening guide. If anything happens to it, don't hesitate to find me at any time. This plant comes with a Forest Watcher lifetime guarantee.I'll have you know a lot of flowers are in season on your birthday. It took me forever to choose one. I'll get you a different species next year!

f7a88c6752f29921.voiceContent: Germinating seeds break through the soil and take root.

9d6d7e5f245f607e.voiceContent: Seedlings grow, reaching out with their branches and leaves.

f67fa055a8724e07.voiceContent: Branches dotted with flower buds herald the advent of spring.

9c43924d79dd625c.voiceContent: A rich harvest that will lead to even richer ones.

e8ad54cc5706cce4.voiceContent: Everything happened so fast, and I didn't get the chance to properly thank her. To have a capable and reliable person like her on your side is extremely fortunate. I'm sure she must have many groups trying to persuade her to join their ranks. But she definitely doesn't strike me as the kind of person who would be interested in joining the Akademiya or the Forest Rangers, so I'll spare myself the inevitable rejection.

919f296ede51a312.voiceContent: Madam Faruzan possesses an extensive wealth of knowledge. I often invite her to inspect the mechanisms in the rainforest. The next time she's in Gandharva Ville... *sigh* I hope she doesn't sneak Collei more food. Nutrition is like medicine moderation is key.

a426ca428cec226d.voiceContent: Sethos? Pretty interesting guy. He's like a distant cousin of Cyno's. Really easy to get along with. Last time he visited us in Gandharva Ville, he insisted on showing off his tent-pitching skills and had a fishing competition with Cyno. Collei got really upset, because she thought there was nothing for her to do anymore...People say Sethos is good at keeping himself amused — he certainly seems pretty cheerful. But he takes his work very seriously. Hmm, although I don't know how accurate work is — I think he sees his role at the Temple of Silence as more of a kind of duty. Anyway, if you ever find yourself needing assistance in the desert, I'm sure he'd be a good person to go to.

ff8e674725ee7c5f.voiceContent: Gah, it's so hot... Even a Mist Flower would melt in this heat... Ah, now that I think about it, it wouldn't... but you get what I mean, hehe... Ugh...

1958c8987807b1eb.voiceContent: This may sound strange, but although the blood of a carnivore runs through my veins, mushrooms are the one food that I can't give up. There are many species of edible mushrooms. Whether fresh or dried, they all give off a unique scent. Even when stewed with meat, it's the mushrooms' aroma that comes out on top.

d5c314ee67cffa7b.voiceContent: Don't worry about Karkata. I told the matra I know that it's my research assistant. If anyone wants to do anything to it, they'll need to go through me. ...Since you seem to care a lot about Karkata, why don't you enroll in some courses at the Spantamad Darshan? That way, you can care for it even if I'm gone.

4ac3ec713d54e86a.voiceContent: Who do you think you are?

353c1aed1f14758f.voiceContent: Excellent ingredients and impeccable seasoning. In short — it's delicious.

ee9ac985ef0fbff9.voiceContent: Nice flavor pairing. Could you give me a copy of the recipe? I want to put this on the menu for the Forest Rangers' next meal.

bd087a56ea775ac7.voiceContent: ...Do I need to teach you some new recipes?

9d8badca2600a646.voiceContent: Don't take it to heart. Just see it as a learning opportunity.

0dcfdbd2f24ceba9.voiceContent: Alright, let's play a game, just for fun.

d8bd2bb4beae1d1d.voiceContent: You're here to play cards, too? Yes, it's good to unwind once in a while, isn't it?

c1dc5672415e490e.voiceContent: Um... Need me to teach you?

0ccc2421f11f6b2e.voiceContent: I'll be leaving soon. This place is starting to make my ears ring...

67d091d791a75725.voiceContent: Your confidence is impressive, but remember... it's important to remain objective about your skill level.

3be346506638d472.voiceContent: Good game. You've clearly been doing your homework.

bd31d7de9c4c3754.voiceContent: Heh, I think you're almost as good as a friend of mine.

0d5f73cf62e67302.voiceContent: You're not a novice anymore, so I won't be going easy on you. Good luck.

22af0fc1e583fa2f.voiceContent: Not bad. You've improved very quickly.

2e501c70e6c655a0.voiceContent: This has been quite the development.

2f300ff364ef8b3b.voiceContent: Huh, I might have underestimated you.

db9c7c029b7233d5.voiceContent: Hey, fluffhead, did you zone out again?
